metadata.title: CVE-2019-14431 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - untriaged
metadata.description: In MatrixSSL 3.8.3 Open through 4.2.1 Open, the DTLS server mishandlesincoming network messages leading to a heap-based buffer overflow of up to256 bytes and possible Remote Code Execution in parseSSLHandshake insslDecode.c. During processing of a crafted packet, the server mishandlesthe fragment length value provided in the DTLS message.

criterions.comment: matrixssl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
